name: Agropelter
description: Mischievous creature known for throwing branches and logs at people.

name: Augerino
description: A worm-like creature that uses its auger-shaped body to drill into dams and let the water out.

name: Bandage Man
description: A ghostly figure wrapped in bandages, said to haunt the coastal area.

name: Batsquatch
description: A sasquatch-like creature with bat-like wings, reported near the volcano.

name: Bigfoot
description: A large, hairy humanoid creature, often considered the most famous cryptid.

name: Ding-Ball
description: Also known as the Dingmaul, this is a cat-like creature with a ball on the end of its tail.

name: Dover Demon
description: A small, humanoid creature with glowing eyes, reported in the 1970s.

name: Flatwoods Monster
description: A tall, humanoid figure with a spade-shaped head, first sighted in 1952.

name: Grafton Monster
description: A hulking monster with no apparent head, first reported in the 1960s.

name: Hoop Snake
description: A venomous snake that is said to bite its tail and roll like a hoop.

name: Hopkinsville Goblin
description: Goblin-like creatures that reportedly attacked a farmhouse in 1955.

name: Jackalope
description: An elusive creature resembling a jackrabbit with antelope horns.

name: Loveland Frogman
description: Humanoid frog-like creature first reported in the 1950s.

name: Mothman
description: A tall, winged creature with glowing red eyes, famously sighted in the 1960s.

name: Not Deer
description: Appears to be a deer at first glance but has unsettling features and behavior.

name: Van Meter Visitor
description: A winged creature with glowing eyes and a horn on its head. Shoots a blinding light from its horn.

name: Vegetable Man
description: A tall humanoid creature that resembles a walking vegetable, first reported in the 1960s.
